properties.areaDesc: West Central Mountains; Upper Weiser River; Boise Mountains
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 11 at 8:50PM MST until January 14 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Boise ID
properties.description:
...WINTER STORM CONTINUES OVER PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN IDAHO AND
SOUTHEASTERN OREGON...

.Periods of snow will continue over most of southwestern Idaho
and southeastern Oregon into early next week. The heaviest snow
will occur in the West Central Mountains of Idaho, where more
than a foot of new snow will fall. Snow may let up for a few
hours at times, but this will be a generally continuous period of
snow in the mountains. The lull in the snow will be a bit longer
across eastern Oregon, the southwest highlands of Idaho, and in
southern Twin Falls County but snow will increase again late
tonight and continue on and off through Monday morning. An inch or
two of new snow is still possible in the Treasure and Magic
Valleys with this storm as well.

* WHAT...Heavy snow. In the west-central and Boise mountains
additional snow accumulations of 10 to 18 inches in mountain
valleys with up to 2 feet over the higher mountains mountains.
In the Upper Weiser River basin additional accumulations of 6
to 12 inches. Gusty winds will accompany snowfall at times.

* WHERE...Upper Weiser River, West Central Mountains and Boise
Mountains zones.

* WHEN...Until 5 PM MST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST TUESDAY
